snippet: A controversial low- and moderate-income apartment complex proposed for the wealthy Westchester County hamlet needs major changes if it is to proceed.
abstract: New York State review issues split decision on eight zoning variances being sought for low- and moderate-income housing project in Chappaqua; ruling will require significant changes to project in affluent Westchester County community, but builder says he is optimistic that alternatives can be found.
lead_paragraph: A controversial low- and moderate-income apartment complex proposed for the wealthy Westchester County hamlet needs major changes if it is to proceed.

headline.main: State Board Deals a Setback to Apartments in Chappaqua
headline.print_headline: State Board Deals a Setback to Apartments in Chappaqua
